question: Marcus-- I'm Doctor Serena Kogan, I'm with Project Angel. You consented to donate your body to science...
answer: Yeah, I'm pretty much done with it.

question: You've been chosen for our research.
answer: Chosen? Lucky me.

question: We just need a couple of signatures...
answer: You don't need to be scared.

question: I'm not. It's nerve degeneration.
answer: Cancer? I'm a regular hero.

question: Thank you. And... I'm sorry.
answer: No one lives forever. What can I say. I was seventeen, I was angry, I was stupid. Hallelujah. Hey! Yo, over here!

question: No one lives forever. What can I say. I was seventeen, I was angry, I was stupid. Hallelujah. Hey! Yo, over here!
answer: Hey mister, where you goin' in such a hurry?

question: You're human... you can see me, you can touch me. This place is real.
answer: This sure ain't heaven.

question: There was only one bullet in that gun.
answer: I don't like it when people point guns at me.

question: It wasn't loaded.
answer: You took on a guy like me with one bullet and an empty shotgun? Pretty stupid.

question: Can I have my gun back?
answer: In the city.

question: In the city.
answer: The city? Oh man. That place is red hot.

question: Seemed kinda dead to me.
answer: No-- radiation.

question: That wasn't a helicopter...
answer: It's an H-K-- hunter-killer. Where the hell have you been?

question: No thanks. Not hungry.
answer: Never heard anyone say that before.

question: I look the same.
answer: You ever watch television?

question: Oh yeah. Was about all I ever had to look forward to in the joint.
answer: I remember TV a little. Cartoons. It was great.

question: She your sister?
answer: Dunno. Been together since we was little. Bunch of us kids was at the day-care center when the bombs fell... she and me are the only ones still around.

question: So this is it? Your life?
answer: We're gonna find the Resistance, fight for John Connor against Skynet. You oughta join us, you're pretty cool.

question: You don't know me.
answer: You're strong, you can read... you didn't kill us. Good enough for me...

question: Skynet runs the machines...? So who's this John Connor?
answer: He's... I don't know. The best. Everybody talks about him. He's the one who's gonna save us.

question: Yeah, right. Him and Jesus.
answer: Who's Jesus?

question: You're asking the wrong guy.
answer: So why were you in prison?

question: I killed a cop.
answer: Were cops like terminators?

question: Well... Nah, some of `em were all right.
answer: You gonna be here when I wake up?

question: Sure.
answer: Good. Stay away from the windows.

question: Just me.
answer: The bible. My grandma always tried to get me into it, but-- it always put me to sleep.

question: Would you read something to me?
answer: "...of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori. Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son Jephunneh--"

question: There's a book inside with pictures.
answer: "Guaranteed lowest prices... open seven days..."

question: What's that?
answer: It's a flower. A rose.

question: So... all those numbers... you could call them and get, like, flowers, or someone to come over and fix stuff, or bring you food...
answer: Guess people had it pretty good.

question: Music?
answer: You know, pianos, guitars...

question: I don't remember music.
answer: Come on. You must... "I can't get no... satisfaction..." "We are family... I got all my sisters with me..." No, huh. How about... "Twinkle twinkle little star..." You OK?

question: Spit it out! Oops.
answer: Yo! Up here!

question: Name's Marcus.
answer: You can put me down now, Marcus.

question: I'm heading that way.
answer: The hot zone? No you're not.

question: I've got to get to my friends--
answer: What friends?

question: Couple of kids. They were in that flying dumpster--
answer: The Skynet transport? It was carrying people? Christ, we almost shot it down. There've been rumors about a concentration camp, but...

question: Hydrobots?
answer: They can't see, but they have killer sonar. They'll attack anything that moves or makes a sound. Even if you get past them, you'd be dead before you covered a hundred yards. If the terminators don't get you, the fallout will-- heavy rads all the way to the Gulf coast, nothing can live there.

question: You're with the Resistance.
answer: Lt. Blair Williams, I fly for what used to be the Air National Guard.

question: I don't know... this has gotta be some kind of, like, dream or hallucination. Like what happens to people right before they die...
answer: That snap you out of it? So let me get this straight, Marcus. There you are on death row, they stick a needle in your arm...

question: Let's hear it.
answer: Whatever they pumped into your veins just knocked you out. This Angel Project you signed up for-- there was a lotta cryogenic stuff going on before the bombs fell, they musta froze your ass.

question: What the hell for?
answer: Drug tests, medical experiments, organ harvesting, who knows? You said you had no family, no friends-- why let a body like yours go to waste?

question: I've never seen trees like these.
answer: We're in a mutation zone. I saw a two-headed squirrel here once--

question: Freaky. What was that?
answer: I didn't hear anything--

question: They're surrounding us.
answer: They're smart. And they don't scare easy.

question: Dog eat dog world.
answer: Thanks.

question: Staf? What's that mean?
answer: It's a resistance term. Sit tight and fuck.

question: I'm not gay. In prison, I thought about puss-- women all the time. But now... it's not working. Who knows, all those years on ice...
answer: Maybe it's just gonna take some time. Before you're completely thawed out.

question: I dunno. They just... sorta reminded me of her.
answer: Who?

question: There's a woman, the last woman I saw before... when I was under, the dead time-- she kept coming to me. I think she must've saved me.
answer: I can't compete with that.

question: Blair? Good to see you. What's the password?
answer: Eat shit and die, Barnes!

question: Close enough. Who's your friend?
answer: Could you get us outta here please?

question: Kinda dumb-ass, wandering around in a mine field.
answer: You didn't maintain the perimeter! Where are your sentries?

question: It's too early for that military crap.
answer: You goddamn idiot!

question: He stepped on a Claymore? This guy oughta be in a hundred pieces...
answer: What are you doing?

question: Does he have a prosthetic limb?
answer: I don't think so.

question: Not what I expected...
answer: This shit is ridiculous. What the hell do you want from me? So do I! I don't know what I am, what I'm doing here, I don't know shit-- maybe I never did, but-- I'm sick of it! Just blow my head off or let me go.

question: This isn't right. I can't be having a conversation with a terminator, Skynet isn't that sophisticated yet. Unless... were you sent here from the future?
answer: What?

question: Skynet's developing a time displacement field, we've decrypted recent data transmissions.
answer: You're out of your mind, aren't you?

question: He's not a cyborg-- no blood, no human tissue over the endoskeleton.
answer: Besides, the first T-800s won't be manufactured until `26.

question: Where did they find him?
answer: I want him extracted. Get him to our best people for disassembly, find out what makes him tick. We need to get into that metal skull, crack his CPU at all costs.

question: Because people trust you... you give them faith--
answer: No. Because I knew I would be, I was told. I know when and where the major battles are going to take place. I know I'm going to send my own father back through time to save my mother-- even though I haven't met him yet. Christ, I even know the year I'm going to die... So how could I not know about this?!

question: Shut up, robot!
answer: How's it going, Barnes? Thought you might like a late-night snack.

question: Where in hell'd you get these?
answer: We got a stash back at the base.

question: Kinda stale.
answer: You need something to wash it down.

question: I'm on duty, you know.
answer: You know I always liked you, Barnes. I just didn't want to join the harem.

question: What can I say? It's our duty to repopulate the planet.
answer: Noble of you to make the sacrifice.

question: C'mere.
answer: I prefer a little privacy.

question: You're so twentieth century...
answer: Men. You're all talk.

question: Men. You're all talk.
answer: Why are you doing this?

question: I don't believe you're a terminator.
answer: So what am I...?

question: Whatever you are-- I owe you one. Once you're free, I'll lie down next to Barnes-- they'll assume you escaped while we were passed out--
answer: You think they'll buy that?

question: Worth a shot. Marcus, Command wants to take you apart, cut open your head. One thing I know, you're alive-- and you've got a right to live. They're already here for you--
answer: I'm heading across the river.

question: No human being can survive there--
answer: I'm not human, remember?

question: You're gonna try and save those kids.
answer: It's the only thing I can think of that makes any sense...

question: Marcus, for all you know, they're dead already--
answer: For all I know, they're the reason I'm back from the dead.

question: Damn it, we're too late--
answer: Where's that go?

question: Should lead out, but there's no way past the fan-- Here. My ELT-- emergency locator transmitter. If you find the camp, activate it like this. It could really help the Resistance.
answer: Thank you. Don't mention it.

question: I need to talk to the prisoner. Lieutenant Williams. I'm sorry about the way you've been treated, but we're forced to take every precaution. I'm John Connor.
answer: Sir.

question: At ease. Please, sit.
answer: Sir-- he isn't a terminator. He's human.

question: We know he's crossed into Skynet territory, why would he do that if he isn't--
answer: He's trying to find his friends.

question: What friends?
answer: A couple of kids. They were taken in a Skynet transport, probably to some kind of prison camp-- he said their names were Star and Kyle.

question: Kyle.
answer: Mm... Kyle something. With an `R.'

question: Reese.
answer: That's it. How did you...?

question: Are you all right?
answer: What the hell is this?

question: You look like you've been hit by a truck--
answer: Among other things. Look, I'm trying to find some friends-- a couple of kids. They were taken here, I saw some buildings--

question: The facility, sure. Hop in, I'll take you there.
answer: Marcus.

question: I can't connect with you at all... your interface must've been damaged. Don't worry, soon they'll have you as good as new.
answer: I didn't think there was-- anything like this left... anywhere.

question: Yes. We're very lucky. Want some?
answer: This isn't food.

question: Well, of course not. Seems you got a little memory loss going on.
answer: Terminators!

question: We don't call them that here.
answer: What are you?

question: A hybrid. The same as you.
answer: A hybrid-- human and machine?

question: Of course. That's what this community is for-- people like us.
answer: Jesus... why?

question: You should be grateful to have been chosen.
answer: What about the ones who weren't?

question: You mean like Janet and the kids.
answer: Your family. You lost them?

question: `Cause I feel good. The interface recognizes negative emotions-- rage, grief, despair-- and stimulates positive endorphins in response. Thank God, life would be pretty unbearable otherwise, don't you think?
answer: Tell me everything. How did you people get here?

question: Most of us worked at NASA or DARPA. I was an engineer on Project Angel--
answer: Angel-- what is it?

question: Advanced Nexus of Genetic and Electronic Life-forms... A-N-G-E-L. You can stop choking me, it's not like I need to breathe.
answer: English!

question: Calm down, Marcus. It's all right.
answer: Like fuck it is. I'm sick of being your guinea pig, what are you doing to me now?!

question: Repairing you.
answer: You all work for Skynet!

question: Please. Skynet works for us. It's only a program-- a tool, a means to an end.
answer: The end of the world.

question: Its sole purpose is to protect humanity.
answer: Into-- this? A brain in a box?

question: Skynet had access to the entire defense web-- including Project Angel. It determined hybrids were the only path to salvation.
answer: Destroying the human race in order to save it.

question: When the resistance attacked our installation, we were forced to self-destruct. We would have taken you with us, but we thought you were in a permanent coma...
answer: No, stop... I don't want it! You're dead inside, all of you!

question: How are you feeling, Marcus?
answer: I'm not sure I know how to describe it.

question: It's called happiness. You've been angry all your life. You don't know what it's like to feel... a part of something. Pure ecstasy... we can share in it together.
answer: When I was a kid my grandmother would go on about heaven... it always sounded so boring.

question: Were you bored just now? Nanotechnology, polymimetic metals... working with Skynet, we're making amazing breakthroughs, well beyond anything possible before Judgment Day. We've already freed ourselves from biological limits... soon we'll transcend the laws of physics.
answer: A time machine... Connor was right.

question: The Resistance leader? You know him?
answer: ...I've just heard him speak.

question: In the world outside-- the survivors think Skynet is the enemy, out to destroy them. Why don't you tell them about all this?
answer: Not everyone can become like us, Marcus. We just don't have the resources to sustain more than a few thousand hybrids.

question: Then why... Some people I knew were picked up, taken here...
answer: A boy and a girl-- in the last day or two?

question: Yes... what is this place?
answer: Part of the neural net-- human minds linked directly with artificial intelligence. The processing power of the human brain is still beyond anything Skynet can manufacture.

question: That's them.
answer: Good news. He'll soon be part of the network-- you'll be able to connect with him.

question: Of course. I... I understand.
answer: I don't know-- I have to go. Will you be all right? Of course you will.

question: So to speak.
answer: We've been ordered not to talk about it-- the hybrids, everything about that place is top secret...

question: Yeah, simpler to keep it man versus machine. Better than anything. Everything made sense. For the first time in my life, I felt... right. It was heaven.
answer: How could you give that up?

question: I never really believed in heaven.
answer: Here. You need these more than I do.
